Portfolio-Level Early Warning System

CoT portfolio-level early warning: extremes, crowding, squeeze/exhaustion, composite stress index.

As of 2025-10-14

Gemini Summary

State of the Market Summary:

  • Speculative positioning shows notable crowding in several sectors as of 2025-10-14.
  • Metals have the highest speculative crowded long share at 0.5000 of their markets.
  • Ags and FX both show significant speculative crowded short share at 0.5000 of their markets.
  • The FX sector exhibits the most negative average Z-scores for speculators (-1.4629) and hedgers (-1.2484).
  • Metals show relatively high positive average Z-scores for both speculators (0.7575) and hedgers (0.6369).

Technical Summary:

  • No sector currently exhibits speculative or hedger z-scores at the absolute |Z| ‚â• 2 extreme threshold.
  • However, FX positioning for both speculators and hedgers is approaching extreme negative levels.
  • Metals display strong speculative crowded long positioning (0.5000 share), indicating a concentrated directional bet.
  • Ags and FX show high speculative crowded short positioning, suggesting potential short squeeze conditions.
  • This broad crowding points to increased potential for volatility or unwinds.

References:

  • `Early_warning_daily` dataframe, latest timestamp 2025-10-14 00:00:00.
  • The `spec_crowded_long_share`, `spec_crowded_short_share`, `avg_spec_zscore`, and `avg_hedger_zscore` data most influenced conclusions.
  • Public CoT data on individual futures contracts would provide deeper insights.
  • Implied volatility indices for each sector would improve future analysis.
